text:
Nice sour that has some very pronounced cherry tones. Fantastic aroma and very mild aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from tavour. Pours reddish in color with not much head. Nice cherry aroma. Taste is oak and cherry with a slight tart
on tap pinkish red pour minimal head tart cherry aroma and flavor ok for the style

slightly pale red with a small amount of quickly dissipating white foam. It smells like berries (cherry, raspberry), slight butter, oak. The flavor is the same, nice and tart but not overly sweet, a bit of spicy woodiness. Crisp carbonation with slightly slick, medium mouthfeel. It finishes with an almost tannic bitter bite. Delicious.

5th November 2016High Wycombe House Warming. Thanks to Paul. Hazy peach tinted amber beer, a few lonely pink bubbles. Palate is light, semi dry ahd mildly crisp. Light tart raspberry eases in to mild floralness. A whisper of yoghurt, but well buried. Light finish. Quite tasty.
Pours ruby read with a tiny head. Lots of raspberries. Nice and sour just the way I like it.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours a sloghtly murky pinkish amber with a rim of off white bubbles. Musty sour aroma with sweet fruity raspberry overtones. The taste has tart raspberry and cherry with farmy hay notes, old books, sherbet, balsamic vinegar and a dry finish. Complex and good.

November 2016 - Bottle share at Theydons High Wycombe Tasting. Thanks Paulie! As Odell Friek. Hazy pinky orange with a foamy pale pink head. Aroma is mostly raspberry and lemon - not screaming cherry. Body is light with tingly carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is again raspberry, tannic and lightly acidic, cherry, a light red wine like merlot. Pretty good stuff. (3.9)
This is a really good cherry sour because its so well balanced. Its sweet, malty, and sour but not of those flavor characteristics are overpowering in this beer. Its just well made.

Pours a stop-sign red, with a pink head that dissipates quickly to just a ring around the edge of the glass. Definite vinegar aroma. Slight metallic and raspberry palate with loads of vinegar. Could be good, but too much vinegar.

HB thanks to Leighton from a bottle thanks to Scopey, chugged at the Heron Quay Hobo tasting Nov-2016. Thanks bros! It pours a clean amber color with minimal head. Aroma is fruity and acidic with nice tart cherries and mixed red berries flavor profile, lemon notes, tart Greek yoghurt, lactic acid. Taste is also acidic but mellowed by the tart red berries notes. Medium bodied with ok carbonation. Overall, very nice

Bottle at The High WyCum tasting, Chez Bois, thanks to Bropey 05/11/16. 
Hazed reddish orange with a decent light crimson cap.
Nose is pissy cherry skins, funk, wood must, light balsa.
Taste comprises puckering cherries, spice, straw, wood must, red berry funk, light fruit balsams.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a mellow puckering edge.
Decent easy drinking sour, approachable stuff but not top draw.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at Colins. It pours cloudy pines - red with a quickly dissipating white head. The aroma is musty, funky, tart cherry, wood, vanilla and fruit pie. The taste is crisp, tart, good mouth - pucker, minerals, bright acidity, wood, vanilla, cherry, sour green apple, lemon sherbet, marzipan with a dry, firmly dry finish. Medium body and fine, pricey carbonation. Fresh, bright, fruity and tart. Nice, juan.

Bottle shared at the hi wy cum. Tasting, 5/11/2016. Many thanks to Scopey for this one. A nice peach pink coloured pour with a a fine loose white head. Aroma is nutty marzipan, cherry. Raspberry. Berry fruits, woody. Flavour is composed of woody, raspberry, woody pips, cherry, funky sour, vanilla. Palate is tangy sour, highish carbonation, woody, melon. Nice. Complexity. Lovely.

Bottle @home (Euro-vision 2016 tasting.) Pours reddish/brown with a slightly off-white head. Nose and taste is all the same funk straight up, cherries, some rhubarb, ive written down cherries twice on this bit of paper it must have been big cherries.
Pours light reddy pink with no head and lots of fizz. Aroma is slight alcoholic cherries. A real lip smacking, dry your mouth, punch in the eye sourness to this. Fantastic. Truly fantastic.

Bottle courtesy of Craig (shared with Craig, cheers mate!) had this at Cropredy 2016 I believe this bottle was consumed on Friday 12th August 2016   This pours reddy brown with a small head. Fruity with the cherries showing but not massively so, woody elements to this also, has a Belgian feel about it. Fruity, tangy and tart and quite good but no earth shaker.  A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov13 3.4
Bottle at gbbf 2016.. Copper.. Thin white lacing.. Big funk fruit.... Zesty tart kriek... Big fruit.. Juicy fruit

Bottle. Pours a cloudy blood orange with a fading light pink bubbly head. Aroma is of raspberry, cherry, cranberry, wood, floral. Taste is of more red fruits, raspberry, cherry, forest fruits, tart. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

750ml bottle at the Head of Steam, Durham. Pale cloudy amber pour, with virtually no head. Sweet whiskey aroma, along with vibrant sour cherry. The flavour is a mouth-wrinkling sour cherry and rhubarb, with a touch of red wine and vinegar brought together in a carbonated mouthfeel, shot through with a tart, jammy sweetness.

Picked up a berrylicious cake at Nakitanitei near Lingua World Cafe in Osaka. 
I got it to pair with Odells Friek which is a 6.9% ale with cherries and raspberries added then aged 2 years in oak barrels.
Its an orange pink color best described as salmon with a fizzy light pink foam that vanished in an eyeblink. Sharp oaky aroma with an almond nut quality I surmise came from the cherry pits. Theres also a tart cherry and raspberry component which I enjoy.
A lovely soft round carbonation that reveals a very acidic, tart cherry, nutty almond and earthy raspberry. This is exceedingly tart, acidic but gives enough berry sweetness in the dry lingering finish.
Man with the cake the berry flavor really pops prompting me to say Wow! While the chocolate gives an amazing sweet counterpoint.
If youve got a berry sour get this cake to pair with it. Superb. On its own Id say hovering around 4 but paired with this raspberry-chocolate cake its easily a 4.2 so Ill split the difference and give it a 4.1.

Bottle thanks to Justin, I think. Nose is super tart. Enough to make your mouth water. Light cherry skin. Taste is puckering sweet and acid reflux kicks in quick. A tad too tart for me but not upland level.

2 oz bottle pour at SAVOR 2016s Saturday session. Clear reddish orange with off-white head. Aromas of tart cherries, vinegar. Tastes of cherries, light vinegar, tart acidic notes. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Nice.

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours redish brown with a significant white head. Aroma of oak, cherries, funk. Taste is very oaky, raspberry, cherry, medium tart, earth. Medium body, slightly acidic, really nice beer.

Sampled at the W&C Place Beer Fest 2016. It poured a ruby color with a white head. The aroma was of fruits and wood. The taste was similar to the aroma with some cranberry, tart cherries, wood, alcohol and finishing with some sourness. Very nice.
Draft. Reddish beer with a cream head. Cherry and light tart aroma. Cherry and tart/light sour flavor/ Medium bodied. Refreshing. Cherry and light sourness lingers with light earthiness.

Bottle. Pour is nearly clear reddish brown with a small white head. Aroma is spicy cherry with light tart notes. Flavor is nicely tart with with light berry notes and a lightly spicy finish. A bit thin but clean. Nice.
Bottle. Pours clear reddish brown with no head. Nose and taste are tart cherry, grape must. Mildly tart and very drinkable.

Appearance: cloudy burnt orange with thin white head
Aroma: Musty with berry, Orange blossom and honey 
Taste: wonderful and bold sour flavor from under the tongue. The amount of cherry is just right lending a perfect sweetness. 
Overall: Textbook example of cherry sour

Bottle, caged/corked. This pours as expected, but wonderfully ... reddish hue, fizzy, thin top. Theres an equally expected sour aroma, waft with tart cherries. The flavor is similar ... taut cherry, angular acidity, and a snappy mouthfeel. As advertised all the way. Quite nice. (#6158, 3/25/2016)

Appearance: no head, hazy ruby colour. 
Aroma: cherries, raspberries, blackcurrant, gueze, acidic. 
Taste: more cherries and raspberries, quite sour, good tartness. 
Palate: medium bodied, good carbonation.
Overall: expensive, but really nice. Very good sourness and the fruit is pronounced really well. Each sip leave me salivating and begging for another.
Sampled at esbls. Pinkish hue. Cherries and tartness. Rich malts. Just a little funk. Good.

Tap at dark horse with commonmac and samadouche and Qponnagy. Light red with small white head. Smells sour and tangy. Really tart . Fruity. Like a Belgian sour and it really goes for it. Aggressive. Good, but not my style
Bottle. Pours reddish Rose. Aroma is Cherries and Oak. Taste is sweet cherry up front with a sour cherry oak finish. Really good.
Pink in apperance. Duller taste related to the oak. There is a lighter raspberry taste.
Clear dark pinkish amber with a pinkish white head. Aroma of oak, cherry, raspberry. Tastes sour and oaky. Very dry, medium bodied, and well carbonated. Yum.
On Tap slightly hazy redish light tan. Thin white head and spotty lacing. Grat combo of woody funk and cherries. Quite tart but not obnoxious. Mellow woody trailer. Very tasty

Draft for official tick 3800. Clear bright red pour with a thin white head. Big sour cherry, raspberry, funky and lactic aroma. Sour and funky fruit flavor, medium fruit but really interesting. Medium to light, quite quaffable (sorry for using that terrible word). Lejizz!

On tap at Served in a snifter. No perceptible carbonation or head. Little to no aroma as well, just a faint whiff of lacto. The taste is extremely tart, very tight with a noticeable cherry presence. Not cloying and not cough syrup cherry either. Finish is extremely dry and clean. Good stuff

10 oz pour at Star Bar. Friek is a red color with no real head. Carbonation is pretty lively. The aroma is noticeably sharp and sour in a clean way. Fruit vinaigrette, oak, cherries are all noted here. Flavor is more of the same but the cherry really starts to compound. While it is certainly clean and natural tasting, the unavoidable character of fruit juice or medicine begins to detract a little from what would otherwise be a really phenomenal beer. There are still a lot of positives here though.

On tap at the Taphouse. In your face sour, readily apparent from the get-go. Pours out kind of dull and unexciting, but more than makes up for it in aroma and taste. Lots of fruit, notably plums, puckering tartness. Cottonmouth dry finish.

Aroma: sour apple, cherry, raspberry, candy, cough drop
Appearance: red, sparkling, medium bubbles, minimal white head
Taste: medium, tart, not overly sweet, slight bitterness
Palate: medium, very fizzy, sour (duh), lively
Généreuse dose de fruits confrontés aux brett et une boiserie glissante. Lacétique est modéré, le jus grand et lagréabilité des plus réussie.

Many thanks to Rian! Nice fresh sourish nose. The beer starts dry, fruity sourish with a nice fresh sourish with hints of mould. Hints of vinegar acid, fresh-sourish, a bit artificial cherries. Sourish red fruity aftertaste. Nice.

Thanks Jwale73!! Pours a hazy rubine red with a large light pink head. The smell is oak, funk, raspberry seeds, cherries. The taste is tart red fruit, seeds very dry aftertaste with oak lingering. Light in body with active, fine carbonation.
Fruchtig säuerlicher, holzig trockener Antrunk. Später süßlicher und etwas künstlich, feinperlig, die Fruchtigkeit bleibt angenehm. Trocken süßes Ende. 10/10/11/11/10/11

Shared at 4th of July. Solid one here. Good body from the wood. Good fruit from the fruit and good sourness from the yeast. All working together really well to create a pretty decadent drink. Bit of an acidic finish but nicely so.
Bomber at GGW 2015. Hazy gold with a white head. Tart tannins and wood. Light barnyard and sour.

Born at a time when few American brewers were brave enough to create beers with wild yeast, Friek is a modern classic. Compared to many of the sour funk bombs and tart Lambics in circulation, Friek is a smooth, fruity ale thanks to its blending and barrel aging. Aroma presents raspberry and subtle cherry-soaked wood. Taste has the sweetness of raspberry and cherry with a bit of oak and citrus. Body is fizzy and acidic but doesnt have the vinegar sharpness of some Sour/Lambic types. Despite its kinky name, Friek goes down easy.

Bottle.

A- Sour, subtle cherries, oak, slight funk.

A- Cranberry color, clear liquid, minimal head.

T- Sour, tart, subtle dark cherries, oak, funk, effervescent, champagne.

P- Medium body, average texture, high carbonation, sour effervescent finish.

O- The cherry and raspberries are very subtle here. Its almost like drinking champagne with such high carbonation. Some notes of oak and plenty of tartness.

18 May 2015, bottle. rosy orange, clear, some steady bubbles. nose is tart cherry and cherry pits. thin and fizzy. has some wine characteristics, moderately tart and fizzy to boot, cherry is noticeable but i think it is blended with another fruit or muted in some way. maybe the wood aging mellows it out. pretty good!
On tap, hazy red amber color, lots of sweet and sour raspberries, nice sour earthy rust , good balanced finish

Smells like a sour red. Taste is mild sour red with faint berry notes. No carbonation. Old bottle, possibly one of the first few batches.

New batch: Much more fruit in the new batch. This batch actually has some carbonation.

Lactic tart aroma with raspberry and cherry aroma and some oaky woodyness. Sour maybe 7 of 10. Quite pucker sour, but still balanced and full flavored and awesome. Berry flavors are prominent, but not sugary sweet and they are nicely balanced with the sour and oaky. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Unclear dark red amber. Virtually no head. Nice raspberry cherry sour aroma. Cherry pie. Flavor follows. Nice moderate acidity and sharpness. Mildly dry. Minimal carbonation.

Plum red in color... Aroma of oak, cherries, berries, light tartness, plums... Flavor is minimally tart, juicy unripened berries, dark fruits, cherry and oak on finish... Effervescent mouth feel... Really good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2015 750ml bottle. Pours copper brown with no head. Strong tart cherry strawberry smell...a little metal. Taste same with great tart fruit and clean finish. Awrsome beer!

750ml bottle along with on tap a few times now. This has gotten better with the most recent batch. Pours out a pinkish brown topped with a small head. Nose is great cherries raspberries strawberries oak and a nice funk. Taste is as the nose with a nice berry mix the barrel is just the right amount. This is a tasty one.
Sour. Nearly clear. Cherry. Still don?t like sours but I could see why this is good.  Thx carter.

Thanks to Kraddel. 750 ml. fair chunk consumed. Pours clear red bright raspberry syrup with no head. Nose is sweet cherries & some raspberry, more sugary sweet tan actual fruit, tad syrup-like, funk is very light, tad wood. Taste is light cherry, raspberry syrup, sweeter than actual fruit, light malt, iron, touch candy, sweetish, light wood, sourness is almost no there. Body is a touch thin, light iron & syrup. As a fruit beer this is pretty good. The constant use of lambiek-style on the label is just ridiculous, this just isnt in the same ballpark. This is closer to sweetened Lindemans than anything else in the lambiek world in my opinion. Still on its own, this is a nice beer.

Bottle thnx to elliot. Pours clear amberred., small to no white head. 
Smell is funky fruity. Bit oak. 
Taste is bourbon. Sour, cherrie. Raspberry is hidden. Sharp carbo.

Clear red brown pour with a thin quickly fading white head. Strong tart cherry, oak, and funk aroma. Taste is tart cherry, vinous, damp wood, and earthy funk. Very dry finish with an oaky aftertaste. Really nice beer.

Pours a reddish brown with a thin white head. Quite effervescent. Aroma big on cherries and raspberries, oak and funk. Taste follows, raspberry forward, slightly sweet upfron with a funky sour note, finished dry and oaky. Solid.

Pours reddish brown with fizzy white head out of bottle. Aroma of berries with funky yeast. Smooth flavor of strawberries, raspberries, and oak with a sour zest. Excellent beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Reasonably clear reddish light brown with a small pale head. Aroma is raspberry, cherry, red currants. Medium bodied, sweet and fruity on the palate. Taste is raspberry, cherry. Nice.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 "our batch was between 6.5-6.9%. multiple krieks blended, oaked, and raspberries added, so its a framboise kriek = friek. huh? get it get it? anyway, this beer is freaking amazing. the cherry, oak, and raspberry are in perfect harmony...you can smell and taste each clearly but none are too overpowering. the aroma is vibrant fruit with a lively mouthfeel. near mouth puckering tartness and sweetness from the fruit expertly balanced. I will buy this whenever i see it."
Tasty cherry tart. Nice balanced. Light funky. One of the better ones on the night. Enjoyable.

I brought this to the Pre-Ffej of July Party.


A - Pours murky red with a small one finger tall white head leaving little to no lacing down the glass. It was carbonated at least.


S - Smells of your typical kriek but with a bit less sweetness. Hints of cherries, dulled funk, light sourness, and wet oak. It was pretty funky initially but it faded as it warmed up and allowed some of the sweet fruits to come through.


T - Starts off with a nice dose of tart cherries slowly giving way to a mix of dry oak tannins, dulled fruity sweetness, and light horse blanket funk. Based on the nose I thought this one might be pretty funky but it isnt. Finish is a mix of light sweetness and dulled sourness, lingering for a short period of time. Pretty good.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Light tartness in the feel, lingering through the finish.


O - I enjoyed this one. The flavors worked well together and it never got to the point of being overpowering. I didnt detect much of the raspberries but it still had plenty of cherries to make up for it.

750ml from Papago. Pours a clear cranberry red with zero head. The nose is tart cherries, vanilla and light lacto. The taste is sour raspberries, unripe cherries, earthy funk and woody vinegar. Medium prickly mouthfeel. Nice. 3.7

Appearance: clear pour (initially) the color of sparkling grapefruit juice; quickly vanishing, fizzy pink head; extremely active carbonation jets rising like a reverse rainstorm, feeding a small puddle of fizzy bubbles on the surface.  Aroma: 	brightly tart, with sour cherries and raspberries, a bit of pomegranate, nice oaky notes, with a low undertone of brett and worn leather. Taste: 	cherries and raspberries up front, sweet, tart and sour, with some light chocolate, vanilla, wood, and herbal notes.  Finish: lightly dry, with a lingering, delicately sharp sour note that scrubs the tongue, leaving only a hint of stone fruit and a longing for the next sip. Notes: Gone all too quickly. A magnificent beer. Reminiscent flavor and aroma profile of a Rodenbach Grand Cru, but with a lighter, tarter, sharper body. Wonderful.

Bottle share at RBAG. Pour is pink with minimal white head. Aroma is nice Brett funk, sour tart cherries, and some light sweetness. Taste is prickly carbonation, mild tartness up front, followed by some cherry fruit sweetness, finish is slight acidic.

Bottle share at Proof. Deep amber pour with virtually no head. Aroma of cherry, lactic acid, cheese funk, oak and citrus. Flavor is sour cherry and dark fruits, lactic acid, sharp sourness throughout with underlying caramel malts and sweetness. Pretty nice.
Pours a hazy pink color with light and very fizzy head. Oak, tartness, light fruits, funk, and more wood on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes very tart and dry.

August 24th, 2012 - Heres a treat: a special indulgence to mark the last evening of my summer vacation, to conclude my stay with my family back home, and a kick-off before returning to a strict and stringent ketogenic diet. With a special kind of affected reverence, I poured the Friek into my favorite glass (which has not nor will travel with me for fear of breaking it), revealing a brew with a blushing peach color, and little to no head. Theres a moment of alarm as I consider the possibility that the beer has gone flat, but I see enough bubbles in the body to assuage myself. I dont have to crane my head too far to take in the aroma - the dominant note is an oak sourness that reminds me of some of the heavier Belgian brews my old roommate and I used to sip with relish back in Colorado. Lighter touches of rose, vanilla, sour cherry, and some dark chocolate shavings decorate the central pillar of sourness and pungent wood like a pagan decoration. On the taste I catch more ripe raspberry than I did on the nose, and a lighter, brighter cherry flavor swells and takes on more prominence. Overall, the flavor of the Friek begins very quiet and placid, ramping up as the sourness and oak burn kick in, and then bringing in a cornucopia of little sweet fruit flavors. After that, its a quick drop from the cacophony of tastes, leaving a low, exhausted oak note and a lumbering, deep, mashed raspberry and cherry taste to contrast with the earlier, brighter fruit notes. In the case that you couldnt tell from the above, this is a powerful beer drinking experience. Each sip brings the drinker on a roller coaster loop of flavors and tastes, replicating the peak and drops. This is a fruit beer worth splurging on, and a worthy way to end a relaxing vacation home with the family.

750 ml partagée avec rodenbach99. Un liquide qui me semble être rouge. Une absence de tête mousseuse. Un nez de framboises, de petits fruits rouges aigres et de barrique qui transpire la noix de coco. Simple mais ô combien efficace. Des saveurs agréables, il va sans dire. Mes papilles aiment le profil acidulé/acide et la capacité lactique de cette bière dite sauvage. En bouche, un liquide mince qui est cependant bien gonflé par les bulles. La finale est aussi bien plaisante, simple et efficace avec un fruité qui assèche la totalité de ma bouche. Facile à boire et facile à aimer. Jai bu mon verre en 4 ou 5 gorgées.

Une grosse bouteille bue avec Patrick. Un liquide il de perdrix qui ne mousse pas. Un nez de fruits, de cerises, de framboise et de notes sauvages. En bouche les fruits dominent, une sorte de bonbon acide, simple et avec un peu de coco.

750ml bottle, cellared for 18 months. Pours a lively, champagne style bubble fest, with a hazy pinky, orangey amber pour. Lively head quickly disappears to nothing. Sour, tart fruity, funky, woody, sweaty, barnyard, leathery aromas. Puckering sour, fruity, acidic, funky, sweet flavours. Medium bodied with a lively carbonation Finish is bitter, sour, dry & long.

Bottle share at Proof. Rosy pink in color with only the thinnest of collars, and no head present. Aroma is fruity (more raspberry than cherry) and tart/dry yeast. Taste is sour cherry, a slight raspberry, but mostly just sour and not well balanced. Light body, low carbonation and tongue puckering from the tartness.
Bottle.(digging up this old rating) ruby pour with white head. Cherry, tart, light oak and funky aromas. Flavors are mainly of tart cherries, lacto and Brett tones.
750 mL bottle. Deep ruby brown with an average off-white head. Aroma is of plum, funk, berries, sour, cherry. Taste is sour, plum, light apricot, heavy cherry, berry, wood, and leather.

Bottle. The look is reddish to brown, clear, with a thin head. The smell is cherry, pie, dessert, fruits, tart, lacto, acidic, and laffy taffy. The taste is fruit roll ups, cherry, pie, tart, nice, and slight vinegar.

Ale Alpharetta. Got this in a recent trade and it did not let down. Fantastic in fact. Red/brown pour with minimal off white head. Smell is lots of cherries, sweet barrel, hints of vanilla. Taste is more cherries, lots of sweet vanilla/oak notes, other berries. Mild, smooth, medium tart. Just a simplistically good sour.

Sample at Ale Alpharetta. Pours a hazy orange, with almost no head. The aroma is bitter oranges, with some cherries and vanilla. Very sour, with some fruity sweetness. Heavy body, sticky, and a little clingy. Overall, this is a nice, fruity beer, but lacks the subtlety, balance, and body of a great sour ale.
Poured from bottle 22oz. Red and clear with little head. Fruity cherry cool aid aroma. Sour punch and tropical taste. Smooth and good for this style.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 First rating750 ml bottle thanks to mybestfriend! On March 18, 2014.Hazy copper to brown color, small white head. Acidic to sour, fruity, some vinegar scent. Acidic, a bit metallic taste. Metallic aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, very low bitterness.7/3/6/3/12=3.1RerateBottle at Odell Brewing Company in Fort Collins, on April 6, 2014.Clear copper color, small white head. Sweet, cherry scent. Cherry, acidic taste. Cherry, acidic aftertaste, a bit metallic. Fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.8/4/8/2/16=3.8

On tap at Papago.
Complex aroma of sour cherries, white grape, pickle juice, strawberries, and faint oak. Almost clear, dark orange-red under white, lacy wisps. Fresh sour cherry and white grape that starts sour and finishes sweet. No bitterness, clean finish, not quite mouth puckering. Medium light body, moderate carbonation. Would benefit from slightly more sourness and/or carbonation.

Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy amber color with ruby highlights and a slightly off-white head with pinkish hues. Aroma is tart cherries, strong acetic acid. Both are quite present in the flavor with a bit more of the sweetness shining through. Still quite sour, which lingers long into the finish. Excellent sour!

2012 bottle I think. very red shade of amber, fizzy off white head. Aroma is quite tart with a lot of cherry, no raspberry in the nose. Taste is very fruity, tart but not sour. Good blend of cherry and raspberry here. Thin with high carbonation. Pretty good for an American sour but nothing to write home about.
Bottle - Tart berries and funky. Clear pinkish orange with a head that disappears quickly. Tart berries and and a really nice finish. Dont get the barrels. Well done but a bit pricey.

On tap, poured a ruby hue w/ small white fizzy head. Light to moderate sour fruit aroma. Initial flavor is a light sweet w/ a bold sour finish. Tastes are cranberry, tart cherry, and rose. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, slight watery mouthfeel, and dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle thanks to Brandon. Pours a cloudy brown with small beige head. The aroma is cherry skin, oak, and funk. Medium mouthfeel with a light tart cherry skin and wood with light sour finish. Good.
pours an orangy red hue, thin white head. tartness upfront, undertones of berry and cherry sweetness. think body, seems a little over carbonated but that is my only grip. still excellent.

Wonderful sour - nice color, no head, great nose. Nice balance of sour with fruit. Heavy cherry, and slight oakiness. Loved it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750 bottle. Redish peach color pour. Aroma is a mildly tart sour. Taste is sour with a touh of fruit cherries and berries. Smooth and low carbonation for a sour. Decent stuff. Very drinkable.

Awesome fruit flavors when fresh. Strong tart cherry for most of the body, but it finishes with a bubbly hint of sweet raspberries. After cellaring for 12 months, it drinks like a very sour kriek beer, and has almost none of the fresh fruit qualities. I prefer it fresh, but still a solid sour after some cellering.

750mL bottle, sent from mista (thanks a lot, Geoff), pours a fairly clear dark amber orange with a small beige head. Aroma brings out lots of sour cherries and raspberries, oak barrels, and wood. Flavour brings out both sour cherries and sour raspberries, oak barrels, and some wild yeast notes. Very tart fruity, with the oak quite prominent. Very well-made - the fruits are a little muted, but theyre well situated. Not overly sour, but very well-made. Great stuff.
Draft at Stub & Herbs. Slight white head, ruby red in color. Great cherry nose. Beautiful sour beer with a touch of sweetness, strong but not overpowering oak character. Excellent!
Poured on tap at Poppys in Estes Park, CO. sour cherry on nose with walnut and malt, sour cherry taste with malt sweetness and really long finish of cherry. This is an excellent kriek.

Bottle. Pours a clear red with a white head. Aroma of lots of berries: cherry, raspberry, strawberry, sour and sweet, malt, sugar. Taste is sweet and sour, of berries, malt, yeast, sugar. Lingering tart berries and yeast. Excellent.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2014 Pours brownish red with low head, aroma is funky sweet berries, taste is sour cherry with a light body and quick finish, Happy New Year!
750 bottle..Pour is redish pink with a thin bubbly head..Nose is nice tartness, berries, nice oak, cherries, yogurt..Taste is nice funk, berries, cherry, juice, wet oak, bugs, nice dryness..
Ruby red pour with pink-tinted white head. Aroma of sour fruit, yeast. Flavor is tart cherries and raspberries throughout. Very drinkable sour.

pours a pretty dark pink with a finger of light pink fleeting foam. The beer is pretty. Smells like cranberry, cherry and oak. Some hints of flanders style metallic sourness, lactic sourness and some soil.

Taste comes through moderately tart, some cherry some cranberry again. More oak - this reminds me more of a poorly made flanders than a wild or kriek. Thin mouthfeel with lower than expected carb and a semi wet finish. 

Meh, twice what Id pay again for it.

Serving type: bottle

01-25-2012
This is an awesome sour. Pink and tart with fruitiness that is not forced or candy like. The body is thin with a lactic bite. I really like this one! This one does not disappoint.

2013 bottle purchased at Boise Co-op. A beautiful pinkish copper, light carbonation, moderately tart, makes my mouth pucker more than it seems like it should. Wonderful bright fruit flavors. Not quite as complex as I expected given the barrel aging, but a great, very enjoyable beer.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy amber/reddish with no head. Aroma is of fruits, berries, raspberries. Taste is of fruits, berries, sourness, acidity, raspberries. Palate: Low carbonation. Lacking. Overall: Appearance and carbonation are lacking. Other than that: this is pretty good. Nice fruits.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2013 Bottle thanks to BoostIPA, thanks! Pours a still looking reddish brown with no head. Aroma is of red fruits, hard to to pick the raspberries from the cherries. Some really light bourbon and oak notes, too. Taste is lightly acetic but overall nicely acid (lactic) and fruity. Mouthfeel suffers from the lack of carbonation (damn!) but still offer a clean drinking experience and feels like a good fruit juice. Hopefully Ill be able to rate it again someday in prime condition. Good!

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by mathieuc, thanks! Hazy Copper-ish amber with no head and no lacing. Interesting aroma of raspberries, cherries, nice acidic touch, subtle bourbon notes and light vanilla. Taste is also of raspberries and cherries with a little more bourbon than in the aroma, vanilla, nice acidic presence and light/moderate sweetness. Medium body. Flat. If it was not of the absence of carbonation, this one would probably be a world-class sour. Nice fruits. Very interesting, but the absence of carbonation is a bummer.

bottle gracefully shared by mistermathieuc, many thanks brah. pours cloudy, almost dirty, medium dark copper, red tint - fire cider-like colour. no head. bright cherries and raspberries, distinct and nicely blended, stones - touch of earth, cheese, bourbon vanilla with its hint of sweetness, nice tart profile - lactic, citric and soft acetic. low carbonation, light body - oily, lightly tart and sweet grassy-stoney finish. quite nice but the lack of carbonation is clearly a bummer - it would have been an almost excellent fruit lambic..

Pours an amazing ruby with finger white head that leaves quickly.

Smell is full of cherry, raspberry, and green apple.

Taste is bit of bile, lactic cherry, super red fruit and dominant raspberry flavor. 

Light to mid body, refreshing.

This reminded me of Rose de Gambrinus, very well done.

Pours a clear red with very minimal white head. A few pours contained none at all. Dissipated almost immediately.

Subtle raspberry aromas with some barnyard funk are present. A little bit of oak as well. All aromas are a bit more subdued than most sours.

Taste is pretty good. Again more subtly than in your face boldness. A sweet and sour raspberry flavor is present throughout with a light spice and oak kick near the end.

Feared there was no carbonation at all from the pour, but it was present albeit lower than normal. Mouthfeel is pretty decent.

Overall a good, but not great beer. Good flavors, but nothing extremely great and the carbonation issue knock it down a peg, but would still try again.

Picked up a bottle in SD. Pours light reddish amber with small thin head. Aromas of tart cherries, raspberries, some wood, and bit of acidicness. Flavor of wood, light sweet malts, raspberries, and tart cherries with some acidic sourness. Nice amount of fruit and tartness, but seem a bit unbalanced. Enjoyable beer none-the-less.

Bottle - pours amber red w/white head. Lots of cherries in the nose. The taste is cherries, tart, and acidic. A little thin but not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This brew is a clear reddish-amber color with a medium thin dense light beige head that recedes slowly. Small sticky patches of lacing. Aroma of funky fruit and yeast. Light to medium body with a moderately sour berry and cherry character, with some yeast and malt behind it. The finish is funky with a lingering sour cherry aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Reddish, rhubarb colour beer, slight white head. Aroma of citrus, cherry, rhubarb, funk, yoghurt and raspberry. Light sour flaovur, yoghurt, raspberry and rhubarb acidity. Quite thin, the flavours are gone fast. Finish citrus, rhubarb, fruity raspberry, only a hint of cherry. More like a fruity Berliner Weisse than lambic, but nice nonetheless!
(From 66cL bottle @ ZZT-ish VIII / BBT I. Thanks for sharing, Countbeer!)
Reddish pink. Layers of richness and complexity. Big raspberry cherry oak aroma. Great cherry. Thanks Americo.

Small ashy white bubbly head/lacing on top of a (headless) hazy orange colored beer.
Aromas of wild yeast, malty sour, raspberry, strawberry, cherry, honey, flowers, wood, grains.

text: Bottle @ ZZT8:BBT1. Orange to peach colour with no lasting head. Smells sour, fresh, fruity, nice. Tastes sour, mint, green leafs. Thin to medium body, soft to medium carbo.
On tap at the Mayor. Deep reddish and clear with a white head. Aroma of sour cherries, wood and vanilla. Similar flavor, sour and kind of sweet. Nice.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, deep red with quickly settling white head. No lacing. Aroma is sour, lactic, cherry, and vinous. Flavor is moderately sour, building somewhat, fading to tart cherry, stone fruit, heavily vinous finish. Lactic component becomes quite accentuated once the carbonation is gone. Tarter than I remember, but slightly off on the flavor. I hate to say this bottle may have been past its prime. Moderate carbonation, medium-light body, and dry finish. Quite tart, fruity, and vinous.

Sampled from a 750 ml brown bottle this beer poured a red-amber color with a trace soapy tan head that faded quickly and left no lacing. The aroma was tar and sour cherry and cherry pits. The flavor was tar, sour, vinegar and cherries. Long dry, tart cherry and vinegar finish. Medium body. Ok.

Big thanks to adnielsen for this one ! Pours a berry reddish maroon color with a finger of fizz that settles out quickly/ The nose is a nice rustic blend of sweet cherry and green raspberry. Nice acedic tartness and a touch of barrel oak. The palate follows the nose with great complexity of fruit. Very fruit punchy but an adult version for sure... nice funky berry notes round coating yet refreshing mouthfeel.
Pours a light reddish brown color, you can smell the wood barrels, taste of tart cherries, good overall
Bottle at Yesprs - Thanks. Clear amber/red - white head. Cherry, acid notes, almonds, light sweetness, berries, nice dryness, wooden notes, grapes, tart, nice acid sourish.
Phenomenal beer that doesnt get enough love. The fruit component and the heavy sourness are perfect.

Bottled. Dark amber coloured. Unclear. Dense light beige head. Aroma. Berries, sourness, grape, light tart, spice. Flavour: Grape, sourness, berries, tart, sweetness, spice, light acid. Medium to full bodied. Ends sourish and acidic full of berries. Nice.

Bottle at yespr. 
Hazy orange coloured with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of cherries with notes of berries.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of cherries and red wine.
Tart finish.
75 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is citric and smooth fruity. Brett, oange frui and citric. Bitter and tart. Smooth fruity and dry to citric into the finish.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of fruits and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of brettanomyces, wheat, and cherries, leading to tart finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.

Bottle : Pour is murky red / brown with a modest off white head here, that vanishes quickly in this glass. Ah well - the nose is the highlight for me. Souring character comes through, revealing the cherry skin, berries, moving to some earthen oaked notes. The flavor profile has an initial light tartness, moving to a modest lactic souring note, more berries, cherry juice and skin, a more robust malt profile here of caramel and sweetbread, moving to more tartness near the finish. I found this one to be far too subdued for my liking, however - frankly a little disappointed in its modest mouthfeel and light souring.

On tap at Boulders on Broadway. Pours an awesome, clear, dark brownish red. Aroma of lactic acid and sour cherries. Very tart taste with cherries, some raspberries, and woody notes on the back end with a great deal of acidity. Tart, gritty mouthfeel with an extremely dry finish.

750 mL bottle poured into a tulip glass.  Pours a hazy ruby color with an almost nonexistent white head.  Aroma is tart cherries and a slight funkiness.  Taste is slightly sour to tart and vinous.  I detected flavors of cherries, raspberries, vinegar, and black pepper.  Very good.

Pours a lightly hazy golden amber with a medium bubbly pinkish white head that went away fairly quickly.  Aroma of cherries, oak and funk!  While the funk is less "sour" and more barnyard I liked how it came across with the fruit and wood.  Flavor of tart cherries, oak, vanilla, the wood really lingers.  There is some sourness coming through and that same "funk" that was in the nose.

750 ml bottle via Sparky.  Pours a reddish amber color with absolutely no head at all.  The aroma has a cherry/berry fruitiness, light tart character, wood and some vinegar notes.  The flavor has more fruits, I think the raspberry notes almost outweigh the cherry character, wood, some vinegar, more tart than sour.  This could be a good starter sour since it was more mild.  The finish is a touch soft.

Bottle at home. Pours a deep cherry with minimal head. Aroma is cherries, leather. Taste is tart cherries and oak up front with minimal lingering sourness. Finish is really thin and light; dry. Interesting beer.
Sample when Odell was in town at the local Four Firkins shop.  This one is different even for a sour - big time like.

17/02/2013 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Rossastra con riflessi arancia, schiuma leggerissima bianca che scompare immediatamente. Al naso sentori di frutta rossa, note citriche e acetiche, non un granché. In bocca conferma le stesse sensazioni, piuttosto sgraziata, con un acetico importante, non molto secca e pulita nel finale. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Non allaltezza delle aspettative.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured a hazy reddish brown color with a mostly lasted frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy sour, yeast and tart fruit aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour fruit flavor with a medium to heavy sweet & sour finish of moderate to long duration. This is a solid beer that exceeded my expectations.

750ml bottle, thanks to the alexsdad06. Dark reddish brown hazy color. No head. Nice oaky, tart cherry nose. Lighter body. Light carbonation. Good dry texture. Good tart taste, lightly sour, but no bite. Very nice, tasty, even drinkable kriek.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2013 Poured from bottle a cherry red with a pink head. Smells of funk, barnyard, raspberries, cherrys. Tastes similar to smell but with the funk/tart stealing the show. Mouth feel is light and tingly.

Aroma is raspberry funk bus.. sour.raspberry body.

Beautiful raspberry body.

Bottle compliments of ketchepillar
Pours a reddish orange color with a small head and not a lot of lacing on the glass.

The aroma is very laundry room-esque both dirty and clean laundry.... The funkiness is very nice as are the sour cherry notes. The only thing I dont like is that its got this sort of touch of pool water that never goes away.

The flavor is a very nice balance of tart cherry and raspberry flavors, the beer is sour... but not vinegary or overly sour.... just nicely so with a lot of tartness, a great fruit character... without much sweetness. 

remarkably drinkable.
I cant really give this beer a favorable rating or fair for that matter I hate fruit beers

Not a lot of experience with sours, but this one was damn interesting. Huge cherry sour off the bat with a nice tamer finish. Rasberries are present from the steep, and the brett is clear but not overpowering throughout. I would have again.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Tap at Muddy Pig. Shit like this is going to turn me into a sour-head. Gorgeous purple-red pour with a light pink head. Tart cherry, sweet raspberry, expertly blended. Slight wood notes. Killer!

Bottle 11/22/12:  Bright translucent amber with a pink head.  Sour and tart aroma with oak, tanins, and a little cherry.  Crisp taste, lively mouthful.  Oak, woody tartness, and sour cherries.  The tart lingers... pretty acidic and dry.  Some raspberries in the tail.  Nice.

Bottle pours a clear ruby with a small pinkish tan head. Aroma of tart cherries and raspberries, oak, and some nice yeast funk. Taste is upfront very tart cherries blended nicely with sour funky yeast, mellow oak and raspberry on the finish with some lactic yogurt. Very tasty stuff!
Bottle. Pours a light red almost pink with no head and good carbonation. Aroma is wood, cherry and slight tartness. Flavor is tart cherries and finishes crisp. Not very sour but a nice beer.

December 23, 2012 bottle from AV3.  Light red pour with some head that faded quickly.  Aroma was wood, tart cherry and some funk.  Taste was dry tart cherry and raspberry, little bit of sweetness, woody and some yeast.  Light to medium body, bubbly, very much like a champagne.

Look I hate being one of these people but I wanted to rate it.  Im not too familiar with lambics and this was DELICIOUS, but I dont know what to expect from them, so Ill just trust my judgement.  So sour and flavorful, albeit slightly flat in flavor as I went on.  Reminded me of wine, but the cherry had a strong presence.  Yummy, though.  Shared it with friends, and well enjoyed.  Highly recommended at my work, and I agree.  Beer geeks get ON it.

Bottle on 12/17/12
Pours a clean ruby red with little head.
The nose is mouthwateringly tart, strong in cherries with a cough syrup-like sweetness and a hint of raspberries. Taste is very tart. Lots of raspberry with a cherry tart finish. Very light body with medium carbonation. The raspberries and cherries play off each other very nicely with neither dominating. Very good sour.

Thanks, Jeff! Murky brownish red pour, basically flat, with a decent berry pulp nose. But I found the beer a bit of a disappointment overall, with a thin mouthfeel and a pretty washed out character, failing to deliver much personality on the fruit, funk, or barrel level.

Bottle shared by durwoodx. Thanks Darrell.

The beer is hazy and ruby/orange colored with minimal head. Cherries, oak, and wild yeast make up the aroma. Acetic feel with lots of tart cherry flavor. Well done. Delicious with lots of fruit. Slight pucker in the cheeks. Acetic finish. A solid fruit sour ale.

Reviewed on: 01-15-2012

Pours ruby red with a head that lasts for a fraction of a second. Looks like soda pop. The nose is intense cherry, raspberry, vanilla, vinegar and funk!  Taste is very sweet but the sour balances this beer nicely. The oak adds a very subtle vanilla flavor that blends well. The mouthfeel is crisp and clean, light body and a long finish. Very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at the Richmond Industry Gathering. Pours a hazy purple color with a small head. Aroma of tart fruits, berries, plums and a funky finish. The taste is tart cherries, berries, stone fruits and some funk. Medium bodied.
Great tart crisp fruit flavors and nose.  A little heavy on the wood.  Not one for the cellar.  Great aperitif with some cheese.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2016 Re-rate. Tap at hopes and pie. Clear ruby amber with almost no head. Aromas of tart cherries, raspberries, wood, light funk, vanilla. Flavor is the same. Light plus bodied, acidic and dry. Linger tart cherry and raspberry.

Bottle from Scott - thanks!  Clear, auburn color in the glass with a quickly fading collection of white bubbles for a head.  Steady, aggressive carbonation.  Aroma is dry oak, funk, underlying cherries, and a bit of lemon with a very dry and clean finish.  Taste is dominated by dry cherry followed by minimal funk, tartness, and a sour, cherry burn down into the finish.  Clean and dry.  Definitely closer to an american wild/sour than a proper lambic but there are some fruit lambic aspects to the aroma and taste.  I particularly like the tart cherry flavor and the clean, dry body is spot on for the style.  Im impressed overall.  Great beer.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2013 Massively over-carbed, despite having zero head. Pretty body. Fresh raspberries initially in the nose, turns sulfuric, then back to fruit. Taste is quite nice but subdued. Seems slightly watered down. Gimme a more concentrated version and my cheeks will turn red.

Just had this again (3/23/13) and enjoyed it much more than last time. Fruit is more pungent, not as aggressively carbonated, tasty.

Picked this up recently for $16 despite passing on it earlier in the year. Its dark purple-red-burgundy and had a head for a moment then it disappeared. It is carbonated fine though so maybe my glass was dirty. Smells very woody like barrels and a hint of cherries and Brett. Taste is cherries, tart raspberry, very strong wood barrel flavor, not bad at all. This really doesnt taste like lambic to me but as an American Wild Ale it works. Only problem is the price tag, the quality if this beer does not justify $16 and I would never buy it again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-04-2011 16:54:15

Good sour, but more wild than sour. I had this on cask (firkin), which I believe was an added benefit. The aroma was sour cherry but not vinegar as some of these can seem. Nice dark ruby color with no head. Smooth and oily palate with zero carbonation. Nice mix of fruit and malt. Very little alcohol presence. At times seemed a little dry. Good job.

750 ml C&C bottle served in a Portsmouth Tulip. Not sure who shared this guy, but thanks!

A: Pours a dark cherry color, very much like a Kriek. A thin whitish head forms on the pour and leaves some splotchy lace behind.

S: Tart cherry flesh, grape skins, light funky cheese and some cherry pit.

T: The body has a sweet malty base which is odd. There is some light Greek yogurt, tart cherries and some cheesy funk.

M: Medium bodied with a low end carbonation. Its alright.

O: This was alright, but the taste was just slightly odd compared to the nose and the low carbonation hurt it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-21-2012

(At the brewery)  cloudy red-amber, little soapy bubbles. Nose of cherry pie, tart macerated cherries, honey, light funk. Taste is very tart, low carb, cherries that are fresh, delicious wood linger with the cherry.

Bottle, shared with Dave on the momentous occasion of his 40th birthday celebration. Very hazy bright ruby body with a rapidly receding pink head. Aroma is pleasantly sour and full of tart cherry and unripened berry notes. Flavours are equally tart cherry and tart raspberry, moderately intense lactic acidity and sourness. Woody dryness in the finish. Another terrific brew from Odell.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
In short: A sour, oaky, very tannic ale full of cherries.  Good sipper
How: Bottle 750ml, corked and caged.  Probably 6 to months of age, I think, not sure.  Bottle from Tytoanderso, thanks a lot Tyler.
The look: Cloudy dirty red body with a short lived beige head
In long: Nose is acidic (lactic & acetic), lots of oak, some dust and lots of red cherries and tart cherries.  Taste is pretty much the same, dominant oak presence, lots of oak tannins, lactic and acedic acid, sawdust, lots of fresh juicy red cherries and tart cherries.  Surprising sweet citrus juice concentrate in the after-taste.  Sourness level is in the medium+ range.  The beer is tasty for sure, rather intense and the aroma and flavors are bright and sharp, sculpted with knife.  But the drinkability is low, it took me forever to drink my bottle.  Ive heard they are now making this in 12oz bottles, good idea.  So anyway today sept 18 is our wedding anniversary (true fact) and my wife is asking me are you just gonna sit there entering beer ratings of are we gonna do something for our wedding anniversary?, wow, I have a choice!!! I married the best woman ever, and now shes leaving me alone to not bother me while I enter my ratings.
Poured from a 750 ml bottle, thanks to Ed. The aroma is dusty, earthy, horse blanket. The flavor is lemon, citrus, woody, cherry. Very tasty, not a whole lot of fruit. Great color.

Pours pinkish like a rose. Nice nose of cherries and tart fruit. Really bubbly, almost like a champagne. Super tart with sour flavors of cherry and lemon. I did not pick up much on the wood flavors,but this was great!

750 ml bottle. It pours a very nice red color with a lively, yet quickly disappearing pink head. The aroma is pleasant with cherry, grape skin, light notes of vanilla, wood and acetic acid thats balanced by a touch of sweetness. The flavor is cherry forward with a good amount of tartness on the palate. Vanilla flavors from the wood are a nice complement to the cherries. Acetic acid is very light here, which is a good thing. The body is medium and carbonation is spot on. Overall, its not terribly complex, but I loved the authentic cherry flavor that balanced the sweet and sour elements really well.
Pours an amber color with a thin white head.  Tart cherry with a nice wood flavor and some sweetness.   A nice cherry of sour and tart flavor.  Its pretty good.
Clear copper color with fleeting foam. Light berry fruit, lemon, caramel aromas. Medium body. Berry fruit, honeydew melon, pit fruit flavors--not sour--ok
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: A real decent sour lambic ale, nice cherry aroma, tasty with cherry and raspberry notes, dry sourness but a otherwise a very light bodied ale.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Pale rose in colour with fizzy carbonation. Aromas are of cherry blossom, mild funk, and dry pale malt. Flavours are of sour cherry, lemon pith, a bit of wood and cream. Light bodied with a delicate sourness. Not really a patch on the classic Belgian krieks as it lacks intensity, but nice enough as a light bodied alternative.
Bright cherries and a lasting acidity. Some note of cinnamon or spice that runs through the whole beer and leaves a bit of a strange finish.

750 ml bottle: Pours a clear deep copper amber with a thin-lacing ring of white head. Has a fresh tart cherry nose with some vinous oak and light sweetness. Starts with good effervescence and sweet fruity cherries with a complex tart oak balance. Finishes true to style with lingering tartness.

Bottle corked and caged, poured a light reddish color, almost a hazy pink.  Aromas of soft raspberries, cherries and light funk.  Flavors are the same with some oak added to it.  Not overly sweet, not overly dry, nice mix of the fruit and sourness, great beer overall.

Pours a semi clear rose copper with very little white head. Aroma is a mix of raspberries, dried cherry and oak. Flavor is very tart, unsweetened dried cherries, oak and undertones of dark chocolate actually. Body is light with very active carbonation.

Pours a rose water amber hue with a thin white active head. Nose with subtle barnyard, blue cheese, and unripe berries.  Champagne, lively bubbling burst on the tongue carries notes of cranberry, dry champagne, and  a mossy oak finish.  A faint hint of soap suds at the end.
12oz bottle shared in the DLD line. A fruity sour that seemed really well balanced. You could still pick out the cherries. The fruit was not dominated by the funk. Pleasant.

Huge thanks to deftim13!  Pours a super hazy fruit punch with zero carbonation.  Funky/tangy raspberry sourness in the nose.  Flavor starts a tart, lactic raspberry and ends sour cherry pie filling.  Lightly dry and somewhat bitter/acidic.  Feels relatively thin.  I think that lack of carbonation hurt this one, in my opinion, both in the flavor promotion and palate.  Nonetheless, enjoyable.

Pours a beautiful opaque, hazy pink. Aroma is acetic, vinegar, cherry, sweet fruits/berries. Flavor is awesome, sour and rich, raspberries, cherries, tart, citrus. Flavors lingers also. Really enjoyable.
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours clear reddish brown with a tiny pink head and a strange fruity aroma. There is a delicate cherry flavor with a pleasantly sour finish. A very nice brew.

750 c&c from Brewforia. Pours clear and ruddy with a transient pinkish head. Aroma of cherry and sour. Flavor is tart/sour cherry. Finishes wonderfully tart/sour. Note: Theres a lot of carbonation, but it didnt come out all at once.

750 ml corked and caged bottle purchased at the Four Firkins in St Louis Park, Minnesota.  11-6384 is marked on the label, not sure if this is meaningful. The pour is mostly clear golden ruby with a fizzy noisy white head that starts big (3 inches) then falls really fast.  The aroma is brightly acidic cherry, toasted oak, more tannins from cherry skin and then rich black cherry fruit. There is a nice citrus lemon character as well. The taste starts tart, acidic sour cherry, then the vanilla wood oak, then a touch of toasty malt and finishes with more black cherry tartness. Clean and crisp. The palate is light to medium bodied, sparkly champagne like carbonation, and a tart crisp finish. Not over the top sour, but nicely bright and tart.  Really easy drinking.

Pours a murky brown swamp water look into a tulip glass with minimal head, yes its ugly.  Aroma is vanilla oak, cherries, and more spicy wood aromas.  Taste is lightly funky and moderate to lightly tart with heavy cherry flavors and great barrel notes.  GREAT!
Thanks to daknole!!!! Heavy oak influence, vanilla cherry and lightly raspberries. This is a top sour by far. Fuck yes!!!
Pours crimson in color with a huge head that goes away very quick. Aroma of funk, oak and cherry. Nice and sour with a strong cherry flavor and some serious funk, very acidic. Pretty nice hybrid beer

Bottle thanks to Brad. Poured a dark grapefruit hue with small head, dct lacing. Aromas of funky lactic cherry notes, tons of sour raspberries, nuts, oaky wood. Taste is cherry dominant but also had alot of peach, raspberry, and other spice. This is the perfect frambois kirek hybrid. Awesome.

Poured a beautiful bright magenta, with little-to-no head that quickly dissipated. Huge carbonation, almost champagne-like. Smells of tart cherry/raspberry, funk, and yeast. Taste is medium sour upfront, with a semi-sweet middle, and ends tart & dry. Body is thin, but it works. This beer is crisp, clean and, refreshing. At 6.5% abv, pour me another glass, please.

Nice cherry and raspberry nose, funky yeast notes, tart, dusty, hay, barrel notes. Pours reddish brown amber, lots of carb settles to no head at all. Flavors of raspberry, cherry tartness, hay, dust, barrel wood notes, tart lactic lemon sharpness, some light poopy notes as well. Sharp and acidic, but mellows quickly. Drinkable, balanced, refreshing.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2012 A: As it poured into the tulip glass, the carbonation had a field day. You could hear them. Eventually the head dwindled down to minimal amounts around the edges. The beer itself was a reddish brown in appearance.

S: Some sweet and sour mixed with the barnyard funk. I do believe this is my first beer where I totally get that funky smell and understand what everyone is talking about in regards to that.

T: First thing I got was the tartness from the cherrie mixed with some funk, the raspberries come out towards the closing.

P: Definitely some carbonation there and it works very well. Not being a huge fan of carbonation, this amount of carbonation could easily be offensive to me, but I think it works quite well here. Medium bodied.

O: I really like this one a lot. I am new to the wild ales and I am definitely finding I am a big fan of the style.

Bottle at a recent tasting...  Poured cloud, murky, dark ruby/reddish with a bubbly, grayish head.  Quite acidic with muddled cherry flavors.  Candied sweetness and some yeast funk.  Sort of one dimensional but still highly tasty.

Bottle shared by BenC...thanks Ben! - Pours reddish amber with next to no head. Nice funky nose, light citrus and cherry. Lots of oak, but its not terribly sharp. Tastes pretty acidic with cherries pretty ripe and smooth. Decent amount of oak on the finish, with a nice funky tartness. Pretty slick and not much carbonation. Good stuff.
Thanks Ben.  Lots of tart cherry. Good brew.

Bottle at Coles; Thglassanks to Dak. Poured into a Campus glass: Pours murky tawny/strawberry, like extremely dark grapefruit juice. Head is thin and fizzy, like sodapop. Short lived head dissipates completely, and leaves no lacing. Nose is tart cherry, rhubarb, and some grassy hay/straw notes. Some leather and funk, though this is muted. Flavours of tart berry, oak, nice lambic-esque notes here... Lacks the body and "punch" of a Cantillon or 3 Fonteinen, but a very respectable American pretender.

Very Dark red with no head, although I can see the carbonation. Aroma is rich with sour cherry and sour yeast. Very tart and fruity with lots of subtle oak in the mid palate. This is great it really does have something going on. Great brew.

Bottle, 02/10/2012.  Pours cherry brown, no head, with a still surface.  Aroma dominated by raspberries and tart cherries, juicy, with some lactic notes, hint of yogurt, and funky oak finish.  Flavor has an initial tart, acidic bite, leading into cherry, some balsamic in the mid-flavor, and surprisingly mellow, dry finish with notes of oak.  Palate is maybe a bit thin with low carbonation, but somehow works and reminds me of unblended lambic in texture.

750ml bottle shared by someone at a tasting @ CCB.
Cloudy deep red, sparse head.  Nose is very tart with cherry and ripe berries.  Flavor follows suit with a great sour and woody linger.
Bottle at DSG 2011. Dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is oak, cherry, sourness, fruit, vanilla. Flavour is oak, vanilla, cherry, sourness, fruit, berries. Nice beer.

Pours dark thick cherry murky in color with virtually no head. The aroma brings sour tart cherry and berry notes, perfect, almost reminding me of Cantillon. The flavors are similar bringing tart cherry notes on the tongue to start that settle easily in a juicy delicious way on a well-carbonated balanced body.I love this beer.

750ml Bottle: Got in trade from Phaleslu; THANKS Peter!  Aroma of raspberries, bunk, barnyard, leather, light acetic acid, lambic, slight oak, and some tartness.  Poured orange/red/pink/brown in color with a small, loose, off-white/pink head that disappeared except for around the edges.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Flavor is medium to heavily sweet and medium tart.  Tastes of funk, raspberry, acetic acid, tart fruit, tart cherry, slight barnyard, and a hint of oak.  Medium body.  Lightly dry texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Medium sweet, lightly tart, funk, raspberry, cherry, slight oak finish is lightly dry.

750ml bottle, fairly fresh.  The body sports a cloudy, dark, dusky watermelon hue, yet shows no real head or lace.  Aromas are exceedingly lactic and creamy, suggesting of yogurt or powdered milk tendencies under a shroud of juicy, fleshy, sweet-tart cherry and raspberry notes., along with underlying mild cereal malt sweetness. Flavors largely follow suit, towing the line between sweet and tart, never taking a clear stance on either side of the equation.  Cherry and raspberry flavors seem authentic, but also a bit excessively sugared.  Yeast again comes of quite lactic, but there is no lambic-like buggy funk to be found.  The palate is a letdown, coming across rather flat and lifeless.  Its surprisingly watery as well, definitely lacking in body.  Meh.  Chalk this one up as another fake attempt at recreating "lambic".  Decent brew, but thats about it.

750 ml corked and caged bottle. Pours clear orangeish-red with a medium whitish-purple crackling head that falls into a blanket fairly quick. Aroma is funky tart, cherry. Taste starts out briefly sweet before quickly turning sour. Not as complex as the best lambics or sours. Highly carbonated with the body being a bit too thin. The aroma was more promising than the taste but this isnt bad.

Pours clean bright ruby red with a thin short lived reddish head. Nose shows lots of berry notes and cherry skins with a hint of acetic acid. Herbal notes with some wood also coming through.  Nice tart flavor with lots of cherry skin and a light spice. Some woody notes and raspberry and acetic character.  Dry and acidic finish.

Bottle courtesy of scray24, shared at the December iteration of the Santa Cruz tasting series. Pours the color of unfiltered apple juice with no head. Aroma of fragrant cherry, citric acidity, tart raspberries. Flavor is more lemony than cherry/raspberry but those notes are definitely there. A little light but very drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2012 Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, Ulfborg 2011. Bottle from a trade with tytyanderso. Thanks Tyler ! Pinkish brown color with almost no head. Sour aroma of cherries, vinegar, berries. Moderate sour flavour,some lacto, cherries, berry jam. Dry finish. Very enjoyable.

750 ml. corked n caged bottle- Pours crystal clear amber to red with a quickly dissipating 2 finger head that reduces to a collar and a few lively islands of foam. Aroma is tart cherries and raspberries, maybe a little funk, but that might be me just hoping. The taste is very tart, cherries and raspberries, and the real thing, not syrupy or imitation, unsweetened too. My one complaint is it is kind of one note, and I think it should be in the fruit lambic category, not sour ale/wild ale. Body is medium, carbonation is expectedly high. Overall I have to admit I was expecting more, the tartness is appealing, but a little brett or the  oakiness being a little more prominent would have been nice.
Bottle. Pinkish orange color. Tastes very woody, slightly sweet with quite the sour punch. Fizzy. Fun, but nothing awesome.

2010 bottle via South Dakota bottle shop. Pours a nice copper color with an off white head.  Aroma is of sour and raspberry but nothing that blows you away.  Taste is again, light cherry with a bit of raspberry on the finish but nothing that stands out to me.  Forgettable and very sad for the price.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: 750ml bottle pours a hazy, brick red with a creamy, eggshell head.  Nose is raspberry, woody, lightly tart, malty, a little turbinado sugar.  Flavor is sweet, berries, strawberry, brown sugar, melon, some balsamic vinegar.  Medium bodied, tart finish.  Very approachable.

75cl bottle. Moderate acidity and cherry flavor with a touch of sweetness and more body than I expected. A little acetic. More like a flanders red than a lambic, actually. Pretty good but not quite supplication good.

Bottle shared with northropfrye. It is beautiful, crisp and clear in appearance, red honey colour. It has a sharp and tart aroma. Alarming. Its not as sweet as I was hoping, but having said that I feel like I can taste cloves or something like that.
Bottle in tulip glass. Strong sour vinous aroma. Light pink colour with pink head. Sour cherry taste.

WOW fell in love with this beer Bottle: The aroma consists funky sour cherry and a touch of vanilla. It pours a cloudy brownish-orange with a small off-white pinkish head that quickly fades to a ring around the edges of the glass. The flavor starts with sweet/sour cherry. The finish has lemon sourness and a touch of vanilla. Medium bodied with somewhat lively carbonation

Bottle.  Reddish hazy pink pour, with white slight pinkish head.  Red cherry, raspberry (with seeds), refreshing tartness, oak, light sweetness, and a bit of funk.  Very clean and balanced, delicious.
Refreshing effervescence in the mouth feel.  Cherry nose, lots of cherry on the front.  Raspberry seed on the back with some oak coming through as it warms.  Overall a great lambic.

Thanks to nimbleprop. Reddish brown pour with a small white head. Lactic raspberry seed, cherry juiciness, and very bright lactic acidity gives way to dark fruit juices and hints of must. Medium body with caressing pillowy effervescence.

Had at GABF and loved it.  But the bottle was only good.  Dull, muddy reddish-brown with no head.  The aroma is raspberry with light wood and light cherry.  Smells fairly simple.  Very fruity, almost jammy finish.

Thanks to nimbleprop (I think?) for this one! Beautiful hazy ruby pour with a good sized head. Nose holds lactic acid, tart cherry, raspberry seed, and woody funk. The flavor brings more beautiful sweet fruit and good lactic tartness. Crisp, medium to high effervescence on the mouthfeel. Good stuff!
Pours a hazy brown with a slight pink tint.  Aroma of cherry pie.  Lightly sweet with cherry.  Bitter and tannic.  Light sourness.  Some notes of wood on the finish, maybe some cream and vanilla.

bottle-pours bright red with a small white head.  nose is crazy!  lots of sour cherries, vanilla, lite oak/wood, with lingering red wine character.  flavors of dry vanilla, wood, bitter cherries, and raspberries.  WOW, this stuff is quite good.  I have had 2 bottles of this stuff and i keep changing my notes on this beer.  however, i think i have covered it well now.  lots of sourness here however, its not overpowering and mixes well with all the woody vanilla traits of the barrel aging on this beer.  as the beer warms, more wood and tobacco traits come out-leafy at times.  this is an awesome beer and probably the best to come from this brewery.  I think i may go back to the store that has this and buy them out!

Bottle at The Funky 7, Brooklyn. Pours hazy, red-brown with a moderate, off-white head. Aroma holds plenty of tart cherries, some grassy hops, light funk. Medium sweet flavor, some malts, lots of cherries, some hints of raspberries, brett, wood. Medium bodied with average carbonation and a stinging tartness. Tart, sweet finish, more cherries, light funk, light dryness, some acidity. Very good American sour beer.

Bottle  Fantômepalooza 2011 Pours cloudy and light brown with no head. The fruity aroma furnishes raw white oak, bourbon, caramel and yes, cherries. Medium-bodied with a milky mouthfeel and stinging carbonation. The flavor is all about sour cherries, caramel and raw oak. Finishes tart, tangy and sandy  dries  out. Bottle courtesy of Dstructo!

Bought bottle at kokoman, a store that does not store its beer as well as possible but anyway it pours a nice color but is murky and has no head. Red-brown like a Flemish brown. In fact the aroma follows with rodenbach character and mellow, deep cherry-impacted wood. Comes across as thin and lacking depth, but I attribute that also to the poor storage conditions. But there is really nothing not to like. We have subdued, disciplined acidity, characterful wood tannins, and natural fruit sweetness for balance. Very drinkable and would like to have again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tart and sweet, though mostly tart.  Bright red, medium body, and sour.  A good blend of Krieks, the oak aging is palpable.  5/22/2011.

Sweet and fruity sour beer aroma with hints of cherry and raspberry. Cloudy pink-brown color. Tastes tart and sweet. Highly carbonated- maybe a bit too much carbonation. Very sour and tart finish. Flavors of raspberry, cherry, tannin, and wheat. I think if this had a chance to age a bit, the carbonation and super tartness would even out a bit.

Bottle. Hazy bright amber color, large fluffy white head.  Nice aroma of sour peaches,  apricot, and of course cherries and raspberries. Taste is softly sour summer fruits, grapefruit, citrus. Very nice indeed.
750 ml bottle.  Murky brownish red color,  light white head.  Raspberry aroma.    Great beer.  Tart with a little funk.

Murky amber red color with a head that doesnt linger for very long. Aroma is very intense with lots of vinegary  goodness laced with cherry and raspberry. Also some candy-like notes with winegum. Lots of focus on vinegar, fruits and oak while leaving the yeasts in the background. Some thick, belgian sweetness as well. Taste is very chewy with a candy-winegum sweetness chased by a fairly strong sourness laced with cherry and strawberry. Not a whole lot of tart, leaving it resembling a sour ale more than a kriek. Still, extremely enjoyable..
Bottle shared at TOSPH.  Reddish brown pour with an off white head.  Cheery and wood aromas.  I found it to be a bit watery with sour cherry, wood, vanilla, and tart funk notes.  Thanks Dak...

Bottle thanks to Scott! Pours a hazy deep ruby red with a gray head that dissipates quickly and completely. Aroma is full of sweet cherries with a bit of acidity backing and a bit of funk as well as a bit of oak. Flavor has a good amount of cherries that are mainly sweet with a bit of tartness and backed by oak and a hint of funk.

Cask at Odell, Sweet! Pours a hazy reddish amber, light pink notes in the head that quickly settles out. Nose is nice, pie cherry, yoghurt and more berry notes. Soft graininess and brett funk. Nice nose. On tasting, crisp acidity that isnt overwhelming. Soft and supple, the cherry lives on, spicy pie notes and a dry finish. The cherry tannin is really rounding out. I dig the restrained acidity and the forward brett character. Really nice beer.

750ml bottle brought back from Colorado by my wife. Hazy deep red with a fizzy head that instantly fades to nothing but shows lots of visible carbonation. Aroma of cherries, berries, oak and a light funky barnyard. Flavor is very tart and sour, there is a faint maltiness and a fruity finish. Medium to light body with sparkling carbonation and a very dry mouth feel. This is a very nice beer, you can actually pick out the cherries and the raspberries and they blend very well together.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2012 its official - I dislike/cant handle sours!  I know this is a good one and I wanted to like it (do like it more than other sours tried) but not for me..

 pinkish/brown Aroma was not too strong - with cherry, raspberry and maybe wood?   Better able to drink this than other sours but still too much like wine - carbonation on this was a nice end but cant get past the cherry/wine flavors...

Shared with friends.  Poured pink with a thin white head, faded quickly.  Aroma was acidic, hints of fruit, lingering cherry.  Flavors were big time sour, just slightly funky but quite tart.  The fruit was prominent.  Mouthfeel was light to medium with somewhat relaxed carbonation.  Thanks to fata2683 for the bottle!

On tap at the Odell tasting room in Ft. Collins, CO during GABF week 2011 (actually listed that day as Odell Firkin #38: Cask-Conditioned Friek).  Reddish-brown pour with some tiny bubbles.  Tart and very sour smelling aroma.  The taste is sour but plenty smooth with lemon, tart cherry, and oak.  A very nice sour.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2013 A solid, modestly acetic American sour that has some hints of cherries but doesnt really display a raspberry flavor.  Still good, thanks for the share Smith4498!

More raspberry aroma than in the past.  Very good beer.

Pours like diluted tawny blood with a soapy head that disintegrates at warp speed. A bit shy I guess. Oh I smell that sour red fruit berry character. Medium nectar weight with striking acidity and a deafening sourness that awkwardly enough keeps my attention while my face makes a quick comeback. Bone dry with strong notes of cherries and red berries. The oak influence is only slightly perceptible. Oddly enough this brew keeps me coming back for more. A very well balanced specimen.

Pours crimson red, with a thin white head, little lacing. Aromas of cherry, raspberry, vanilla, with a small note of farmyard and grass. Medium thin body, smooth and tart. Medium initial sweetness, then strong sour starting mid-palate, little bitterness in the finish. Drinkable and very nice.

Bottle kindly shared by RangledeFreak, very appreciated! :)
Pours hazy reddish with almost no head. 
Nice aroma of tart raspberries, oak and dirt. 
Semi sweet and tart flavour of apples, tart cherries, oak, and dirt. 
Long pleasant sour-sweet after taste of apples and cherries.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Tulip.

Appearance: Pretty pinkish-red (kind of a subdued raspberry color) but initial light pink head disappears far too rapidly.

Aroma: Lightly tart and sweet - aroma of cherry, raspberry and oak. So no surprises here.

Taste: Lightly tart - the cherry and raspberry complement one another nicely, which is good for me since I do not usually like it when beers become too cherry-centric. Some nice malt backing with light oak characteristics. Some light peppery notes at the finish.

Palate: Moderately high carbonation, fairly light body, dry and tart finish.

Overall: Very solid Lambic-style ale here. Not mind blowing but nicely balanced, light, pleasing and very refreshing. Another great job by Odell

750 ml. bottle. Shared with Gabe. Pours a minimal off white head, over a hazy reddish amber (SRM 12) body....nose is raspberry, cherry, acetic type acid, bit of barnyard funk....taste is barnyard funk, lemon, raspberry, light cherry all dominated by a medium sour acid....mouth feel light, carbonation adds a gentle spritz. This is a complex, many layered, refreshing beer. It is not as "Bretty" as many in this overall style, but is quite good no the less. BJCP 7/3/15/4/7

Bottle thanks to dionysus. Pours purplish raspberry tea. Nose/taste of cherry vinegar, sour raspberry, oak, dark chocolate and wild yeast. Body on the thinner side. Finishes with above average tartness.

750 ml bottle shared by Craig. Pours a deep red/brown color with a medium brown head. A awesome nose that is pure goodness: sweet rich cherries, massive sweet vanilla oakyness, tart sawdust. The flavor is a mellow oaky sweet vanilla and earthiness with a robust sour cherries and some funkiness. Very drinkable and tasty. Awesome.

750ml bottle thanks to Sparky 
Appearance: Clear red/brown with a small head and light lacing 
Aroma: Tart cherries and oak 
Taste: Tart cherries, woody, vanilla with a dry finish 
Very nice and enjoyable.

Bottle 750ml. @ The Danish Summer Gathering, TFODRBSG11.Clear light to medium brown red colour with a small, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is light moderate malty, moderate to light heavy cherry, wood, funky brett ;O) Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, dry, tart, lacto. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110820]
Cherry aroma and ruby brown beer. Not particularly sour or funky but drinkable.

Tasted on 8/23/11 from a corked and caged 750mL bottle shared by a friend, thank you Rachel.  Pours blood orange-red with thin off-white bubbles that disappear quickly, and leave just a very thin collar of lace.  The nose is tart and somewhat sour with some funky barnyard earth, but it is dominated by funky natural cherries that range from lightly sweet grenadine (I know its pomegranate) to sour and tart.  The flavor is a little sweeter than the nose would have suggested, dominated by the cherry with with tart, sour, notes, along with some earthy barnyard funk and light malt.  The body is a little lighter than medium with light, but stinging carbonation and a long tart cherry, sour, and tannic finish.

Bottle to snifter. Pours ruby red with little bubbles. Aroma wood, wine and tart raspberries. Taste is sour funky woody fruit and berries (nice and sour, more than I was excpecting!) Palate is medium calm carbonation and a very dry sour finish. (makes me want more) This stuff is pretty tasty glad I finally broke down and bought one!
Botella. Cloudy dark brown. Sweet fruity tart, pleasant aroma. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is fruity sweet and tart , pleasant,

Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, Ulfborg 2011. Pours cloudy red with a small creamy pink head and lacings. Sweet cherries and a bit of barnyard. Funk with a minimal note of almond, wood and lots of cherries. Really fresh and fruity. Crisp and dry.
Bottle @ FOneFan. Hazy dark red with small pinkish head. Flavour is malt, cherries, little tart, little barnyard, wood, fruit, sour and vinegar.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark amber/red. Aroma and taste are rich cherries, brett, wood, vinegar and hops.

Rating #1900! Bottle from a trade with cbkschubert and shared at Maltzillas tasting. Pours cloudy amber color with thin tan head. Aromas of sour cherries, raspberries and some oak. Similar flavors. Medium body with lively carbonation. Another really nice brew from Odell. Thanks Craig!
